text: The ancient legend of "Khamba Thoibi" () is one of the epic cycles of incarnations of Meitei mythology and folklore, that is originated from Moirang kingdom of Ancient Kangleipak (early Manipur). Among the countless retelling editions of the epic story, the Khamba Thoibi Sheireng () is the national epic poem of the Manipuri people (Meitei people) of Manipur and is written by Hijam Anganghal. The events in the epic took place during the reign of King Chingkhu Telheiba (1093 AD-1148 AD) in Ancient Moirang. The saga is based mainly on romance, struggle, chivalry and intrigue, popularized by the bards of Moirang kingdom. The romantic saga of Khuman Khamba and Moirang Thoibi has deep religious importance to the culture of Meitei people. The terms, "Khamba" means "Ultimate or fullness" and "Thoibi" means "Perfection of beauty and accomplishments". == Notes == == References == == Other websites == * Khamba Thoibi * Khamba Thoibi epic Category:Meitei folklore Category:Meitei literature Category:Meitei mythology
title: Khamba Thoibi
